p: The Covid-19 virus infection began in China and despite Western skepticism about the number of confirmed cases, it seems that the number of new confirmed cases of the coronavirus originating within China as opposed to Chinese returning home has stopped indicating an effective period of social confinement of some 3–4 months. As David Cyranoski ( 2020) reports in Nature: ‘Researchers are studying the effects of China’s lockdowns to glean insights about controlling the viral pandemic.’ It seems obvious that China’s extreme lockdown has been successful in limiting the spread of the virus. The only problem was that the lockdown started too late and also that the free flow of important scientific information (and whistle blowing) was halted in the early stages.
